title: S4 Ep34: Propaganda, persuasion, and the Nazis
itunes:title: Propaganda, persuasion, and the Nazis
description: In 1932, Hitler and his followers believed that marching through the streets of Hamburg in uniform would convince its citizens to vote him into power. But did the flags, songs and stomping boots actually persuade people? Hans-Joachim Voth tells Tim Phillips how polling data (and the spread of a pandemic) reveal whether this type of propaganda actually worked.
itunes:author: VoxTalks
dc:creator: VoxTalks
